name: espalier
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] a tree, usually a fruit tree, that has been made to grow in a flat shape against something such as a wall or fence: Her gardens always include espaliers. Grow the shrubs as espaliers, in the same way as you might an apple or pear tree.
[ C ] a frame or wire for a tree to grow along in a flat shape against something such as a wall or fence: Pear is my favourite blossom, either in a big tree with the blossom piled up like clouds, or stretched out along espaliers.
[ U ] a method of making trees, usually fruit trees, grow in a flat shape against something such as a wall or fence: He became fascinated by the ancient pruning and grafting technique known as espalier. In 17th-century England and France, espalier was very fashionable.
More examplesFewer examplesEspaliers are trained flat against a fence or wall, each with a vertical central stem and horizontal tiers of branches trained out on either side.He wanted the walls covered by espaliers of flowering jasmine.The shrub is suitable for hedging and espalier.

to make trees, usually fruit trees, grow in a flat shape against something such as a wall or fence: On the walls of the courtyard and buildings, I'll espalier some fruit trees.
